      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • createScene

        public javafx.scene.Scene createScene()
        Instantiates the game board with all checkers and squares, as well as UI
        Returns:
        The gridpane that contains all checkers and square objects that make up the game. A new game of checkers.

      • createBoard

        public javafx.scene.layout.GridPane createBoard()
        Creates the 2d array representation of the gridPane board, also sets the mouseClick listeners for each square and checker.
        Returns:
        2d representation of the game board

      • handleSquareClick

        public void handleSquareClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        When a user selects a square before selecting a checker, will display an error message.
        Parameters:
        event - On a user clicking a square

      • handleCheckerClick

        public void handleCheckerClick(javafx.scene.input.MouseEvent event)
        When a checker is clicked, this method changes its color to indicate to the user their currently selected checker, will also display an error message if the checker selected does not belong to the current player. Also allows for a player to click the selected checker again to deselect it.
        Parameters:
        event - Checker being clicked

      • indexToPixel

        public double indexToPixel(double index)
        Used to orient the position of a checker after a move
        Parameters:
        index - Target square x or y position
        Returns:

      • refreshScene

        public void refreshScene()
        Updates the scene after each move, also checks if the game should be ended

      • finishTurn

        public void finishTurn()
        Changes the players turn, and updates the UI to match whose turn it is

      • proposeMove

        public void proposeMove()
        Checks if the currently selected checker can move to the selected square. This method also will move the checker and call the removeChecker method to remove any checker that has been jumped. This method will also "King" checkers that make it to the opposite end of the board. Will report an error if the move is invalid.

      • removeChecker

        public void removeChecker(application.Square s)
        Removes a jumped checker from a board, updates the global jumpMade variable to true
        Parameters:
        s - The square on the board that holds the checker that has been jumped/needs to be removed

      • resetCheckerColors

        public void resetCheckerColors()
        Resets the color of the selected checker, used after a player deselects a checker and when a turn is over

      • endGame

        public void endGame()
        Ends the game, does not allow for any checker to be clicked.
